name: Agricola
learning_curve_desc: Complex worker placement and a multitude of rules make Agricola challenging to learn.
strategic_depth_desc: Deep strategic planning and engine-building elements result in very high strategic depth.
Replayability_Desc: Deep strategic planning and varying family dynamics ensure a new experience with each play.

name: Anachrony
learning_curve_desc: Anachrony's innovative time-travel mechanics and resource management yield a steep learning curve.
strategic_depth_desc: Multiple strategic paths and the ability to borrow from the future provide high strategic depth.
Replayability_Desc: Multiple paths, expansions, and the time travel mechanic keep each session engaging and unique.

name: Android: Netrunner
learning_curve_desc: Its asymmetrical rules and deep deck-building require significant initial investment to master.
strategic_depth_desc: Intricate mind games and shifting strategies yield high strategic depth.
Replayability_Desc: Asymmetrical deck-building and variable strategies ensure a fresh challenge each time.

name: Ark Nova
learning_curve_desc: Managing enclosures, sponsorships, and conservation projects introduces moderate complexity.
strategic_depth_desc: Card synergies and multiple strategic choices create a rich strategic experience.
Replayability_Desc: A large deck and diverse paths keep each session unique and engaging.

name: Arkham Horror
learning_curve_desc: A lengthy rule set and thematic narrative result in a high learning curve.
strategic_depth_desc: Reliance on dice and scripted events limits strategic depth somewhat.
Replayability_Desc: Story-driven scenarios offer replayability, but familiar narratives can reduce long-term variation.

name: Axis & Allies
learning_curve_desc: The multi-phase war structure and numerous unit types require moderate learning time.
strategic_depth_desc: Long-term economic and military planning contribute to high strategic depth.
Replayability_Desc: Though strategically deep, repetitive board dynamics and dice combat can make repeated play feel similar.

name: Bang!
learning_curve_desc: Simple rules and secret roles allow for a quick setup and easy play.
strategic_depth_desc: Heavy reliance on chance keeps strategic depth relatively low.
Replayability_Desc: Social interactions create variety, but limited strategic options can lead to repetitive sessions.

name: Battleship
learning_curve_desc: Straightforward grid-based rules make Battleship very easy to learn.
strategic_depth_desc: Limited options and heavy reliance on pattern recognition yield minimal strategic depth.
Replayability_Desc: Simple grid-based play and predictable strategies result in low replay value.

name: Battlestar Galactica
learning_curve_desc: A complex mix of cooperative play and hidden roles creates a moderate learning challenge.
strategic_depth_desc: Crisis management and negotiation add layers of strategic depth.
Replayability_Desc: Variable crisis events and social deduction dynamics create different experiences in each play.

name: Bohnanza
learning_curve_desc: The simple rules of trading and card management are easy to pick up.
strategic_depth_desc: Negotiation and timing provide a modest level of strategic depth.
Replayability_Desc: The trading and negotiation aspects ensure that each play feels different.

name: Brass (Lancashire)
learning_curve_desc: A detailed economic simulation with multiple phases results in a high learning curve.
strategic_depth_desc: Long-term planning and economic management offer very high strategic depth.
Replayability_Desc: Diverse economic strategies and market fluctuations provide varied gameplay experiences.

name: Carcassonne
learning_curve_desc: Simple tile-placement rules make Carcassonne very easy to learn.
strategic_depth_desc: Random tile draws and tactical placement yield moderate strategic depth.
Replayability_Desc: Random tile draws and an expanding board layout keep each game feeling fresh.

name: Castles of Burgundy
learning_curve_desc: Dice-driven tile placement and a variety of actions create a moderate learning curve.
strategic_depth_desc: Optimization challenges and multiple scoring avenues provide high strategic depth.
Replayability_Desc: Multiple scoring avenues and strategic decisions yield high replayability.

name: Caylus
learning_curve_desc: Intricate worker placement and timing mechanics require a steep learning curve.
strategic_depth_desc: Pure decision-based gameplay with little luck offers very high strategic depth.
Replayability_Desc: Tactical worker placement offers variety, though similar strategic patterns may develop over time.

name: Checkers
learning_curve_desc: Extremely simple rules make Checkers very easy to pick up.
strategic_depth_desc: Limited strategic variety leads to modest depth compared to more complex games.
Replayability_Desc: Limited strategic variety and quick mastery make repeated play somewhat predictable.

name: Chess
learning_curve_desc: Basic rules are learned quickly, though mastering the game takes years.
strategic_depth_desc: Endless opening variations and deep tactical play result in enormous strategic depth.
Replayability_Desc: Endless strategic possibilities and evolving tactics ensure that no two games are ever exactly the same.

name: Citadels
learning_curve_desc: Simple role selection and bluffing mechanics are easy to understand.
strategic_depth_desc: Reading opponents and timing your moves provide moderate strategic depth.
Replayability_Desc: Role selection and bluffing introduce variety, though patterns may repeat in experienced groups.

name: Clank! Legacy
learning_curve_desc: Combining deck-building with a legacy system creates a moderate learning curve as rules evolve over time.
strategic_depth_desc: The narrative progression and evolving board state add strategic layers throughout the campaign.
Replayability_Desc: The evolving legacy elements keep it fresh, though repeated campaigns may lose the element of surprise.

name: Concordia
learning_curve_desc: Straightforward economic rules set in ancient Rome make Concordia accessible.
strategic_depth_desc: Efficient card management and map expansion provide significant strategic depth.
Replayability_Desc: Different maps, expansions, and strategic approaches ensure repeated enjoyment.

name: Descent: Journeys in the Dark
learning_curve_desc: A moderate set of rules for dungeon crawling and miniatures combat make it accessible.
strategic_depth_desc: Scenario-based challenges and tactical combat yield medium strategic depth.
Replayability_Desc: Scenario-based campaigns offer variety, though a fixed storyline may eventually become predictable.

name: Dixit
learning_curve_desc: The game’s simple, image-based rules make it extremely easy to learn.
strategic_depth_desc: Emphasis on creativity and storytelling results in minimal strategic depth.
Replayability_Desc: Its creativity-driven gameplay means that different groups can produce varied, fun experiences.

name: Dominion
learning_curve_desc: Deck-building mechanics are straightforward but require learning various card interactions.
strategic_depth_desc: Optimizing your deck through diverse card choices leads to high strategic depth.
Replayability_Desc: A large card pool and diverse deck-building options yield high replay value through different combinations.

name: Dune: Imperium
learning_curve_desc: Combines deck-building with worker placement in the Dune universe, requiring moderate learning to master its unique mechanics.
strategic_depth_desc: Interplay between combat, intrigue, and resource management delivers solid strategic depth.
Replayability_Desc: Leader abilities and card synergy create variety across multiple plays.

name: Eclipse
learning_curve_desc: Its blend of 4X exploration and economic management presents a challenging learning curve.
strategic_depth_desc: Multiple paths to victory and resource management yield high strategic depth.
Replayability_Desc: Multiple paths to victory and diverse strategies ensure high replay value.

name: Eclipse Second Dawn
learning_curve_desc: An updated version that refines the rules, resulting in a slightly higher learning curve.
strategic_depth_desc: Improved components and streamlined rules add further layers to its strategic depth.
Replayability_Desc: Multiple alien races, tech paths, and random galaxy setups keep each session distinct.

name: El Grande
learning_curve_desc: Simple area control and card mechanics make it easy to learn.
strategic_depth_desc: Tactical maneuvering and timing considerations add a high level of strategic depth.
Replayability_Desc: Area control and player interactions vary each game, though similar strategies may emerge.

name: Food Chain Magnate
learning_curve_desc: A heavy economic game with intricate rules on hiring and marketing requires a steep learning curve.
strategic_depth_desc: Managing a fast-food empire with multiple strategic avenues provides very high strategic depth.
Replayability_Desc: High strategic depth and multiple paths to victory ensure strong replay value.

name: Fury of Dracula
learning_curve_desc: The one-versus-many hidden movement system is moderately challenging to learn.
strategic_depth_desc: Bluffing and coordinated planning provide a fair degree of strategic depth.
Replayability_Desc: Asymmetric play and variable scenarios offer some replay value, though experiences can become familiar.

name: Galaxy Trucker
learning_curve_desc: The real-time ship building and component functions are moderately easy to learn.
strategic_depth_desc: Heavy reliance on luck limits its strategic depth.
Replayability_Desc: Random hazards and ship-building variability offer fun, though sometimes unpredictable, gameplay.

name: Gaia Project
learning_curve_desc: A space-themed successor to Terra Mystica with intricate rules and faction mechanics, resulting in a high learning curve.
strategic_depth_desc: Deep strategic planning with minimal luck provides very high strategic depth.
Replayability_Desc: Varied factions and board setups provide extensive replay value for fans of complex euros.

name: Game of Thrones: The Board Game
learning_curve_desc: Complex area control with negotiation and secret orders creates a moderately high learning curve.
strategic_depth_desc: Diplomacy and tactical choices yield high strategic depth.
Replayability_Desc: Negotiation and shifting alliances add variety, but a fixed map can limit overall diversity.

name: Gloomhaven
learning_curve_desc: A complex cooperative campaign with evolving rules and legacy elements makes it challenging to learn.
strategic_depth_desc: Tactical combat and character progression provide rich strategic depth.
Replayability_Desc: A rich campaign with evolving scenarios and legacy elements provides varied experiences over multiple sessions.

name: Hanabi
learning_curve_desc: Its cooperative rules and limited communication make Hanabi easy to pick up.
strategic_depth_desc: Deduction and teamwork add a moderate layer of strategic depth.
Replayability_Desc: Cooperative deduction and variable team dynamics provide a fresh experience each time.

name: Hive
learning_curve_desc: Simple movement rules and no setup make Hive easy to learn.
strategic_depth_desc: Pure abstract tactical play offers high strategic depth.
Replayability_Desc: Deep abstract strategy with endless tactical possibilities ensures high replayability.

name: King of Tokyo
learning_curve_desc: The dice mechanics and simple rules allow for rapid learning.
strategic_depth_desc: Limited strategic choices result in modest depth.
Replayability_Desc: Random dice rolls and limited strategic options lower the replay value over time.

name: Existence
learning_curve_desc: Existence is a ridiculously complex reality game where the rules are made up as you go along, and the manual is written in a language you don't speak. You start with a character who's still figuring out how to walk, and the first level is called 'Surviving Childhood' – complete with obstacles like broccoli and bedtime. As you level up, you encounter challenges like 'Finding a Job' and 'Adulting,' which are basically just endless loops of paying bills and pretending to be a functioning member of society. But don't worry, there are power-ups like coffee and Netflix to help you through the tough times. And just when you think you've reached the final boss, life throws you a curveball and says, 'Surprise! You're now in charge of your own mini-game called Parenting!' Good luck
strategic_depth_desc: Infinite
Replayability_Desc: Wouldn't you like to know.

name: Lords of Waterdeep
learning_curve_desc: Accessible worker placement within a rich thematic setting makes it moderately easy to learn.
strategic_depth_desc: Balanced strategic choices through quest management yield moderate strategic depth.
Replayability_Desc: Diverse quests and strategic choices offer a balanced replay experience.

name: Love Letter
learning_curve_desc: Minimal card interactions result in a very low learning curve.
strategic_depth_desc: Limited strategic options lead to shallow long-term planning.
Replayability_Desc: Short, fast rounds and random draws offer a fresh challenge in each play.

name: Mage Knight Board Game
learning_curve_desc: Notoriously steep learning curve due to multi-layered rules and extensive options.
strategic_depth_desc: Intricate decision-making and campaign depth provide extremely high strategic depth.
Replayability_Desc: Campaign progression and varied scenarios provide replay value, though long playtimes can limit repeated sessions.

name: Monopoly
learning_curve_desc: Varied rules and potential house-rules yield a moderate learning curve.
strategic_depth_desc: Heavy reliance on chance results in low strategic depth.
Replayability_Desc: Heavy reliance on chance and a static board setup lead to a repetitive experience over time.

name: Munchkin
learning_curve_desc: Humorous rules and parody elements make Munchkin easy to learn.
strategic_depth_desc: Heavy reliance on chance and 'take-that' mechanics limits its strategic depth.
Replayability_Desc: Humor and randomness offer some variety, but repeated play can feel similar.

name: No Thanks!
learning_curve_desc: A very simple push-your-luck mechanism makes it extremely easy to learn.
strategic_depth_desc: Risk management elements add a modest layer of strategic depth.
Replayability_Desc: Simple mechanics with risk management yield moderate replay value.

name: Orleans
learning_curve_desc: The bag-building mechanic and medieval theme present a moderate learning curve.
strategic_depth_desc: Recruiting followers and expanding influence create significant strategic depth.
Replayability_Desc: Multiple strategic paths and expansions keep each session fresh.

name: Pandemic
learning_curve_desc: Cooperative multi-role mechanics yield a moderate learning curve.
strategic_depth_desc: Collective planning and resource management add moderate strategic depth.
Replayability_Desc: Variable roles and scenario adjustments offer decent replayability despite some fixed elements.

name: Pax Pamir
learning_curve_desc: A historical game with intricate political and card-driven mechanics that take time to master.
strategic_depth_desc: Shifting alliances and tactical card play yield high strategic depth.
Replayability_Desc: Ever-changing alliances and a dynamic card market lead to varied outcomes each play.

name: Power Grid
learning_curve_desc: Multi-phase economic gameplay and resource market dynamics require focused learning.
strategic_depth_desc: Long-term planning and dynamic markets provide very high strategic depth.
Replayability_Desc: Dynamic markets and economic decisions provide high replay value with each session feeling unique.

name: Puerto Rico
learning_curve_desc: Intricate role selection and building mechanics yield a steep learning curve.
strategic_depth_desc: Multiple strategic options and negotiation contribute to very high strategic depth.
Replayability_Desc: Diverse strategies and variable setups keep the gameplay engaging over multiple plays.

name: Race for the Galaxy
learning_curve_desc: Icon-heavy card play and simultaneous actions create a moderate learning curve.
strategic_depth_desc: Deck-building and engine optimization yield high strategic depth.
Replayability_Desc: Diverse card interactions and multiple strategies ensure that every game feels fresh.

name: Risk
learning_curve_desc: Simple rules for global conquest make Risk relatively easy to learn.
strategic_depth_desc: Dice-based combat and alliance dynamics contribute only moderate strategic depth.
Replayability_Desc: While strategic, repeated play can follow similar patterns due to dice reliance and fixed board dynamics.

name: Rock Paper Scissors
learning_curve_desc: A very simple hand game with instantly learnable rules.
strategic_depth_desc: Almost no strategic depth beyond spontaneous choice.
Replayability_Desc: Its simplicity means there’s little strategic variation, but its spontaneity makes it a fun, quick decision-making game.

name: Root
learning_curve_desc: Asymmetric rules and varied faction abilities create a moderate learning curve.
strategic_depth_desc: Dynamic faction interactions and territory control provide high strategic depth.
Replayability_Desc: Asymmetric factions and dynamic gameplay yield high replay value, with each faction offering a distinct experience.

name: Settlers of Catan
learning_curve_desc: Resource management and trading mechanics yield a moderate learning curve.
strategic_depth_desc: Dynamic board setups and negotiation add moderate strategic depth.
Replayability_Desc: Randomized board setups and dynamic trading provide varied experiences with each play.

name: Small World
learning_curve_desc: Accessible territory control and fantasy themes yield a moderate learning curve.
strategic_depth_desc: Timing and selection of race/power combos create a balanced strategic depth.
Replayability_Desc: Varied faction combinations and board setups keep the gameplay fresh.

name: Spirit Island
learning_curve_desc: A cooperative game with complex spirit abilities and nuanced rules, resulting in a steep learning curve.
strategic_depth_desc: Intricate combos and synergy among diverse powers yield very high strategic depth.
Replayability_Desc: Unique spirits, modular boards, and adjustable difficulty keep the game fresh across many plays.

name: Splendor
learning_curve_desc: Simple engine-building rules make Splendor very easy to learn.
strategic_depth_desc: Timing and planning add a moderate layer of strategic depth.
Replayability_Desc: Multiple paths to victory and engine-building dynamics keep the game engaging across sessions.

name: Stone Age
learning_curve_desc: Straightforward worker placement and resource gathering make it moderately easy to learn.
strategic_depth_desc: Variable resource management and worker placement decisions yield medium strategic depth.
Replayability_Desc: Variable resource management and worker placement decisions provide a fresh experience each game.

name: Summoner Wars
learning_curve_desc: Grid-based tactical combat and unique faction abilities lead to a moderate learning curve.
strategic_depth_desc: Balancing offense and defense on a tactical grid creates medium-to-high strategic depth.
Replayability_Desc: Tactical grid combat offers moderate replay value, though board constraints can limit variety.

name: Terra Mystica
learning_curve_desc: Faction-based territory development and resource management yield a high learning curve.
strategic_depth_desc: Intricate strategic decisions and varied faction abilities result in extremely high strategic depth.
Replayability_Desc: Multiple factions and varied strategies make every game a new experience.

name: Terraforming Mars
learning_curve_desc: Engine building, resource management, and board development result in a moderate learning curve.
strategic_depth_desc: Long-term strategic planning with multiple paths to victory yields high strategic depth.
Replayability_Desc: Multiple paths to victory and diverse strategies keep the game engaging over many playthroughs.

name: Texas Hold'em
learning_curve_desc: Very simple rules make it easy to learn, even for beginners.
strategic_depth_desc: Probability, bluffing, and reading opponents provide significant strategic depth.
Replayability_Desc: Varied hands and bluffing dynamics in competitive play provide high replay value.

name: The Crew: Mission Deep Sea
learning_curve_desc: Cooperative trick-taking rules are straightforward and easy to learn.
strategic_depth_desc: Evolving missions and coordinated play add moderate strategic depth.
Replayability_Desc: Multiple missions and trick-taking challenges offer variety despite simple core rules.

name: The Resistance
learning_curve_desc: Simple voting and discussion mechanics make it very easy to pick up.
strategic_depth_desc: Social deduction and bluffing add a moderate layer of strategic depth.
Replayability_Desc: Social deduction creates different dynamics each play, though core mechanics remain similar.

name: Through the Ages
learning_curve_desc: A civilization-building game with extensive rules results in a very steep learning curve.
strategic_depth_desc: Card-driven systems and long-term planning offer nearly unmatched strategic depth.
Replayability_Desc: Extensive civilization-building and numerous strategies ensure fresh challenges in each play.

name: Tigris & Euphrates
learning_curve_desc: Concise yet abstract tile placement rules yield a moderate learning curve.
strategic_depth_desc: Delicate balance mechanics and conflict resolution provide very high strategic depth.
Replayability_Desc: The balance of conflict and strategy creates a different dynamic with each play.

name: Ticket to Ride
learning_curve_desc: Its simple route-building rules make Ticket to Ride very accessible.
strategic_depth_desc: Moderate strategic planning in route selection and blocking yields decent depth.
Replayability_Desc: Route choices and varied ticket draws offer moderate variety, though strategies often converge.

name: Too Many Bones
learning_curve_desc: Unique dice-builder RPG mechanics and character-specific skills create a steep learning curve.
strategic_depth_desc: Robust character development and tactical combat provide solid strategic depth.
Replayability_Desc: Character variety and randomized encounters keep the experience fresh over many sessions.

name: Twilight Imperium (3rd Ed.)
learning_curve_desc: An epic space opera with a massive rule set that takes significant time to learn.
strategic_depth_desc: Diplomacy, warfare, and resource management interweave to provide high strategic depth.
Replayability_Desc: Epic scope and strategic diplomacy provide varied experiences, though long playtimes can reduce repeat sessions.

name: Twilight Struggle
learning_curve_desc: A card-driven representation of the Cold War that requires mastering complex historical events.
strategic_depth_desc: Intricate asymmetrical gameplay and deep strategic decisions offer extremely high strategic depth.
Replayability_Desc: Asymmetrical play and deep historical strategy offer high replay value with each match feeling unique.

name: Underwater Cities
learning_curve_desc: Card-driven city-building rules set underwater demand moderate learning.
strategic_depth_desc: Balancing resource management and engine-building yields high strategic depth.
Replayability_Desc: Diverse card combos and board layouts provide strong replay value.

name: Viticulture
learning_curve_desc: Worker placement and vineyard management rules create a moderate learning curve.
strategic_depth_desc: Balancing vine planting, harvesting, and wine production offers solid strategic depth.
Replayability_Desc: Seasonal worker placement and different visitor cards maintain variety.

name: War of the Ring
learning_curve_desc: The thematic recreation of Middle-earth with asymmetric play creates a high learning curve.
strategic_depth_desc: Balancing narrative objectives with tactical decisions offers very high strategic depth.
Replayability_Desc: Thematic narrative and varied objectives keep the game engaging, despite some repetitive elements.

name: Wingspan
learning_curve_desc: Engine-building with bird cards is easy to learn thanks to clear, intuitive rules.
strategic_depth_desc: Diverse bird abilities and set collection mechanics provide moderate strategic depth.
Replayability_Desc: A large bird card deck and multiple strategies keep it interesting over many plays.

name: Wits & Wagers
learning_curve_desc: Extremely simple trivia and betting rules result in a minimal learning curve.
strategic_depth_desc: Limited strategic decision-making leads to low overall strategic depth.
Replayability_Desc: Trivia content can become repetitive, limiting its long-term replay value.
